net.sourceforge.taglets.simple.shutdown
Class RegexReplacer

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.taglets.simple.impl.AbstractSimpleTaglet
      net.sourceforge.taglets.simple.shutdown.RegexReplacer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ShutdownSupport, SimpleTaglet
public class RegexReplacer
extends AbstractSimpleTaglet
implements ShutdownSupport

Performs regular expression replacements on a list of files.

Configuration parameters include:

files
A file pattern of files to apply the replacements to. Relative to the JavaDoc output directory.
token.<number>
Regular expression to find. Numbering starts at zero.
value.<number>
Replacement value for the token with the same number.

Example:

Taglets.shutdown.fixup= net.sourceforge.taglets.simple.shutdown.RegexReplacer
Taglets.shutdown.fixup.files= **&#x2F;*.html
Taglets.shutdown.fixup.token.0=foo
Taglets.shutdown.fixup.value.0=bar
Taglets.shutdown.fixup.token.1=quux
Taglets.shutdown.fixup.value.1=another

The above example, if used in a taglets configuration will replace all occurences of 'foo' with 'bar' and all occurences of 'quux' with 'another' in all *.html files found in the documentation generated by JavaDoc.

Version:
1.7 (2008/03/30 12:43:22)
Maintainer:
Bruno Essmann <essmann@sourceforge.net>

1.9.2, replaces ../../../../.. in the replacement string.

getDocRoot

protected String getDocRoot(File file,
                            File directory)
Calculates the documentation root directory for the specified file and root directory.

The path returned is usable in HTML links, e.g. for file /home/doc/sub1/sub2/foo.html and directory /home/doc this method will return ../...

Notes

Returns null if the file and the directory given do not have a common parent directory.

All calculations are done on the files passed in, convert the files to their File.getCanonicalFile() prior to calling this method to make sure you get a result based on the canonical files.

Parameters:
file - the file for which to calculate the relative location.
directory - the directory to calculate the path relative to.
Returns:
the documentation root directory that can be used as a HTML link path or null if it cannot be determined.
Since:
1.9.2

configure

public void configure(Logger logger,
                      Configuration configuration)
Description copied from interface: SimpleTaglet
Configures this "simple" taglet.

Notes:

The SimpleTaglet.configure(Logger, Configuration) method is called at the start of the taglet lifecycle, prior to calling any output methods.

The configuration parameters of each "simple" taglet are taglet specific.

Specified by:
configure in interface SimpleTaglet
Overrides:
configure in class AbstractSimpleTaglet
Parameters:
logger - the logger to use for message output during configuration.
configuration - the taglets configuration to use for configuration.
